info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 11 at 2:51AM CDT until August 11 at 9:30AM CDT by NWS Goodland KS
info.description:
Heavy rain from thunderstorms Sunday evening lead to flash flooding in and near St. Francis. Flooding, especially in low lying area, is expected to continue across the county until the morning.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of northwest Kansas, including the following county, Cheyenne.
* WHEN...Until 930 AM CDT Monday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 250 AM CDT, emergency management reported ongoing flooding across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... St. Francis, Bird City and Wheeler.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM CDT THIS MORNING
